snippet: Weeks before a new edition of the so-called bible of mental disorders is released, the federal government’s most prominent psychiatric expert said it had a scientific “lack of validity.”
abstract: Dr Thomas R Insel, director of National Institute of Mental Health, says latest edition of Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, or DSM, suffers from scientific 'lack of validity;' says so-called bible of mental health does not reflect complexity of many disorders, and its way of categorizing mental illness should not guide research.

byline.original: By PAM BELLUCK and BENEDICT CAREY

lead_paragraph: Weeks before a new edition of the so-called bible of mental disorders is released, the federal government’s most prominent psychiatric expert said it had a scientific “lack of validity.”

headline.seo: Psychiatry’s New Guide Falls Short, Experts Say
headline.main: Psychiatry’s Guide Is Out of Touch With Science, Experts Say
headline.print_headline: Psychiatry’s New Guide Falls Short, Experts Say

keywords.value: Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders (Book)
keywords.name: creative_works
